data.title: Sean C. Knowles
data.meta_description: Sean handles securities litigation, corporate governance matters and litigation, and SEC enforcement investigations.Sean Knowles represents public companies
data.text:
Securities & Corporate Governance Litigation

Creative Solutions, Inc. Litigation

King County Superior Court (Washington)

Pierce County Superior Court (Washington)

Defend director against breach of fiduciary and related claims by purported shareholder.

Cocrystal Pharma, Inc. Securities and Derivative Litigation

U.S. District Court for the District of New Jersey

U.S. District Court for the Western District of Washington

Defend public company and current/former directors and officers in securities fraud class action and related shareholder derivative litigation concerning public disclosures and purported related party transaction.

Confidential Personal Counsel to Former Public Company Officer

U.S. District Court for the Western District of Washington

Serve as confidential personal counsel to former public company officer named as defendant in federal securities fraud class action litigation and related shareholder derivative litigation.

Confidential Personal Counsel to Former Public Company Director and Officers

U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Texas

Serve as confidential personal counsel to former public company director and officers named as defendants in federal securities fraud class action litigation and related shareholder derivative litigation.

Defend former public company chief operating officer in shareholder derivative litigation.

Defend public company and former officers and directors named as defendants in federal securities class action litigation alleging inadequate disclosures under Section 14(e) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

Delaware Court of Chancery

Defend public company in shareholder litigation alleging failure to hold shareholder meeting in violation of Delaware General Corporation Code Section 211(c).

Defend claims charging that the PIMCO Total Return Fund charged disproportionately high management and other fees in violation of Section 36(b) of the Investment Company Act of 1940.

Defend company and its officers and directors in securities fraud class action and related derivative litigation.

Third-Party Witness Motion Practice

Represent former officer of Countrywide Financial Corporation in connection with motions to quash third-party deposition subpoenas in federal and state courts.

Market Leader Merger Litigation

King County Superior Court (Washington)

Defend company and its directors in shareholder class action merger litigation.

Public Company

Represent public company in connection with shareholder demand to inspect corporate records.

R.P. Martin Yen LIBOR Litigation

U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York

Represent R.P. Martin Holdings Limited in Yen LIBOR litigation alleging violations of Commodity Exchange Act and Sherman Act.

Investigations & White Collar Defense

Private Technology Company

Represent private technology company in SEC enforcement investigation.

Private Financial Services Company

Represent private financial services company in internal investigation of potential employee misconduct.

Public Manufacturing Company

Represent public manufacturing company in internal investigation of potential employee misconduct.

SEC Enforcement Proceeding – Whistleblower Matter

Represent company in investigation arising from potential violation of Dodd-Frank Act whistleblower provision.

Public Company Short Swing Profit Matter

Represent company investigating potential violation of Section 16(b) of Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 by insider.

In the Matter of Countrywide Financial Corporation

Defend officer of Countrywide Financial Corporation in investigations of country's largest mortgage lender and related litigation.

Public Company

Represent public company in FINRA trading review relating to company's announcement of entry into a definitive merger agreement.

Fortune 100 Company

Represent Fortune 100 company in connection with investigation and overseas criminal prosecution of alleged accounting irregularities by subsidiary.

Fortune 200 Manufacturing Company

Defend Fortune 200 manufacturing company in SEC enforcement investigation of accounting matters.

Fortune 500 Company SEC Enforcement Investigation

Defend Fortune 500 company in SEC enforcement investigation of goodwill accounting issue.

State of Washington v. Asurion, LLC, et al.

Defend company in investigation by Washington State Attorney General of alleged misconduct in connection with sales of cellular phone services.

Other Litigation

Prima Technology, Inc. v. Alux Inc., et al.
